column4: How can I get metrics, over time, on how much nautilus is ruining my ability to use my computer?
Thunar, ctrl-a selects all. Nautilus, ctrl-a 'I would like to select all files, please think about it for 5 or 6 minutes, and get back to me, you *$&*&$ idiot'
Is there anything I can do short of paying $100 to have the authors beaten up?
bash: what is select all?
you should just get rid of your gui
or, rather, keep it around for things like firefox and mplayer
I should, except I need thumbnails for sorting the images in the design folder. I use C-x-f but as I age, the ability to parse jpeg in my head diminishes
but not for things like nautilus
+1 for additional cuils
just curious, but what did you mean by ' but not for things like nautilus '
hrm. i suppose that's a valid excuse
as in do everything in bash except web-browsing and movie-watching
if you're not using links, and running all your movies through an ascii filter, you're doing it wrong.
so fail for you. but - what editor do you use?
vim
oh, fail. I can bench press 300lbs with my pinky.
explain?
heh. debian's vim developer recently switched to emacs
have you heard the joke: emacs is a great operating system but it lacks a good text editor?
I think I was out getting drunk and laying women when they told that one
I am using textmate now - I am finding more developer support on mac than linux, crazy
